snippet: Self-identification may account for Pew’s finding of 6.9 percent of adults as mixed race, compared with the 2010 census, which reported 2.1 percent of adults as multiracial.
abstract: Pew Research Center survey finds that 6.9 percent of American adults are multiracial, more than three times the percentage reported by the 2010 census; poll indicates steep upward curve in multiracial population, but also finds that some 61 percent of those people identified themselves by just one race.
lead_paragraph: Self-identification may account for Pew’s finding of 6.9 percent of adults as mixed race, compared with the 2010 census, which reported 2.1 percent of adults as multiracial.

headline.main: Report Says Census Undercounts Mixed Race
headline.print_headline: Report Says Census Undercounts Mixed Race
